column1: noldo (earlier pronounced ngoldo or ŋoldo) is a noun meaning "One of the Noldor" in Quenya (the Noldor were the second tribe of Elves of the Great Journey).
Image:Noldo.gifNoldo is also the name in Quenya of the nineteenth letter of the Tengwar alphabet.  It is the third letter of the fifth grade or Tyellë
column2: which contains "nasal" consonants and it is the fifth letter in the third series of consonants.  For written Quenya or Sindarin
column3: the third series is used for the k-series
column4: the Calmatéma and this letter represents initial NG or Ŋ.  In Westron the third series is used for a variety of consonantal sounds and this letter represents NY.  The Westron name for this letter is Nyé.See Westron Tengwar

column1: The word derives from the Primitive Quendian Sundocarme ÑGOL.
* http://www.uib.no/People/hnohf/qlist.htm Quenya Corpus Wordlist edited by Helge Fauskanger
